content.question: Suppose n is the average number of hours a user spends using the application each day. Which of the following algorithms can be used to assign the correct categorization to a user?

choices.label: If n is greater than 5, categorize the user as a top user. Otherwise, if n is less than or equal to 5, categorize the user as a regular user. Otherwise, categorize the user as an inactive user.
If n is greater than 5, categorize the user as a top user. Otherwise, if n is greater than or equal to 1, categorize the user as a regular user. Otherwise, categorize the user as an inactive user.
If n is less than 1, categorize the user as an inactive user. Otherwise, if n is greater than or equal to 1, categorize the user as a regular user. Otherwise, categorize the user as a top user.
If n is greater than or equal to 1, categorize the user as a regular user. Otherwise, if n is less than 1, categorize the user as an inactive user. Otherwise, categorize the user as a top user.

content.answer: If n is greater than 5, categorize the user as a top user. Otherwise, if n is greater than or equal to 1, categorize the user as a regular user. Otherwise, categorize the user as an inactive user.

skill.text: 1.A: Determine an appropriate program design to solve a problem or accomplish a task.
